title: Coronavirus Study of Bats in China Met NIH Grant Requirements, EcoHealth Says
sub_head: Nonprofit is under fire for its work with Wuhan Institute of Virology in China in 2018
body:
The National Institutes of Health and a high-profile grant recipient are at odds over the reporting and handling of a potentially risky coronavirus study in China.
EcoHealth Alliance, the grant recipient, pushed back this week against an assertion by the NIH that it failed to promptly report the result of the experiment, which took place in 2018, and to meet another requirement of a $3.4 million grant to study the risk to humans of coronaviruses circulating in bats in China.
